question: Shape it up you guys!... Biggs? I didn't know you were back! When did you get in?
answer: Just now. I wanted to surprise you, hot shot. I thought you'd be here... certainly didn't expect you to be out working.

question: The Academy didn't change you much...but you're back so soon? Hey, what happened, didn't you get your commission?
answer: Of course I got it. Signed aboard The Rand Ecliptic last week. First mate Biggs Darklighter at your service... ...I just came to say good-bye to all you unfortunate landlocked simpletons.

question: I almost forgot. There's a battle going on! Right here in our system. Come and look! There they are!
answer: That's no battle, hot shot... they're just sitting there! Probably a freighter-tanker refueling.

question: ...so I cut off my power, shut down the afterburners and came in low on Deak's trail. I was so close I thought I was going to fry my instruments. As it was I busted up the Skyhopper pretty bad. Uncle Owen was pretty upset. He grounded me for the rest of the season. You should have been there... it was fantastic.
answer: You ought to take it easy Luke. You may be the hottest bushpilot this side of Mos Eisley, but those little Skyhoppers are dangerous. Keep it up, and one day, whammo, you're going to be nothing more than a dark spot on the down side of a canyon wall.

question: Look who's talking. Now that you've been around those giant starships you're beginning to sound like my uncle. You've gotten soft in the city...
answer: I've missed you kid.

question: Well, things haven't been the same since you left, Biggs. It's been so... quiet.
answer: Luke, I didn't come back just to say good-bye... I shouldn't tell you this, but you're the only one I can trust... and if I don't come back, I want somebody to know.

question: What are you talking about?
answer: I made some friends at the Academy. ...when our frigate goes to one of the central systems, we're going to jump ship and join the Alliance...

question: Join the Rebellion?! Are you kidding! How?
answer: Quiet down will ya! You got a mouth bigger than a meteor crater!

question: I'm sorry. I'm quiet. Listen how quiet I am. You can barely hear me...
answer: My friend has a friend on Bestine who might help us make contact.

question: You're crazy! You could wander around forever trying to find them.
answer: I know it's a long shot, but if I don't find them I'll do what I can on my own... It's what we always talked about. Luke, I'm not going to wait for the Empire to draft me into service. The Rebellion is spreading and I want to be on the right side -- the side I believe in.

question: And I'm stuck here...
answer: I thought you were going to the Academy next term. You'll get your chance to get off this rock.

question: Not likely! I had to cancel my application. There has been a lot of unrest among the Sandpeople since you left... they've even raided the outskirts of Anchorhead.
answer: Your uncle could hold off a whole colony of Sandpeople with one blaster.

question: I know, but he's got enough vaporators going to make the place pay off. He needs me for just one more season. I can't leave him now.
answer: I feel for you, Luke, you're going to have to learn what seems to be important or what really is important. What good is all your uncle's work if it's taken over by the Empire?... You know they're starting to nationalize commerce in the central systems... it won't be long before your uncle is merely a tenant, slaving for the greater glory of the Empire.

question: It couldn't happen here. You said it yourself. The Empire won't bother with this rock.
answer: Things always change.

question: I wish I was going... Are you going to be around long?
answer: No, I'm leaving in the morning...

question: Then I guess I won't see you.
answer: Maybe someday... I'll keep a lookout.

question: Well, I'll be at the Academy next season... after that who knows. I won't be drafted into the Imperial Starfleet that's for sure... Take care of yourself, you'll always be the best friend I've got.
answer: So long, Luke.

question: I have no need for a protocol droid.
answer: Sir -- not in an environment such as this -- that's why I've also been programmed for over thirty secondary functions that...

question: What I really need is a droid that understands the binary language of moisture vaporators.
answer: Vaporators! Sir -- My first job was programming binary load lifter... very similar to your vaporators. You could say...

question: Do you speak Bocce?
answer: Of course I can, sir. It's like a second language for me... I'm as fluent in Bocce...

question: All right shut up! I'll take this one.
answer: Shutting up, sir.

question: Luke, take these two over to the garage, will you? I want you to have both of them cleaned up before dinner.
answer: But I was going into Toshi Station to pick up some power converters...

question: You can waste time with your friends when your chores are done. Now come on, get to it!
answer: All right, come on! And the red one, come on. Well, come on, Red, let's go. Uncle Owen...

question: Yeah?
answer: This R2 unit has a bad motivator. Look!

question: Uncle Owen...
answer: Yeah?

question: What about that one?
answer: What about that blue one? We'll take that one.

question: Yeah, take it away.
answer: Uh, I'm quite sure you'll be very pleased with that one, sir. He really is in first-class condition. I've worked with him before. Here he comes.

question: Okay, let's go.
answer: Now, don't you forget this! Why I should stick my neck out for you is quite beyond my capacity! Thank the maker! This oil bath is going to feel so good. I've got such a bad case of dust contamination, I can barely move!

question: It just isn't fair. Oh, Biggs is right. I'm never gonna get out of here!
answer: Is there anything I might do to help?

question: Well, not unless you can alter time, speed up the harvest, or teleport me off this rock!
answer: I don't think so, sir. I'm only a droid and not very knowledgeable about such things. Not on this planet, anyways. As a matter of fact, I'm not even sure which planet I'm on.

question: Well, if there's a bright center to the universe, you're on the planet that it's farthest from.
answer: I see, sir.

question: Uh, you can call me Luke.
answer: I see, sir Luke.

question: Just Luke.
answer: And I am See-Threepio, human-cyborg relations, and this is my counterpart, Artoo-Detoo.

question: Hello. You got a lot of carbon scoring here. It looks like you boys have seen a lot of action.
answer: With all we've been through, sometimes I'm amazed we're in as good condition as we are, what with the Rebellion and all.

question: You know of the Rebellion against the Empire?
answer: That's how we came to be in your service, if you take my meaning, sir.

question: Have you been in many battles?
answer: Several, I think. Actually, there's not much to tell. I'm not much more than an interpreter, and not very good at telling stories. Well, not at making them interesting, anyways.

question: I think she was a passenger on our last voyage. A person of some importance, sir -- I believe. Our captain was attached to...
answer: Is there more to this recording?

question: Behave yourself, Artoo. You're going to get us in trouble. It's all right, you can trust him. He's our new master. He says he's the property of Obi-Wan Kenobi, a resident of these parts. And it's a private message for him. Quite frankly, sir I don't know what he's talking about. Our last master was Captain Antilles, but with what we've been through, this little R2 unit has become a bit eccentric.
answer: Obi-Wan Kenobi? I wonder if he means old Ben Kenobi?

question: I beg your pardon, sir, but do you know what he's talking about?
answer: Well, I don't know anyone named Obi- Wan, but old Ben lives out beyond the dune sea. He's kind of a strange old hermit. I wonder who she is. It sounds like she's in trouble. I'd better play back the whole thing.

question: He says the restraining bolt has short circuited his recording system. He suggests that if you remove the bolt, he might be able to play back the entire recording.
answer: H'm? Oh, yeah, well, I guess you're too small to run away on me if I take this off! Okay. There you go. Well, wait a minute. Where'd she go? Bring her back! Play back the entire message.

question: All right, I'll be right there, Aunt Beru.
answer: I'm sorry, sir, but he appears to have picked up a slight flutter.

question: Well, see what you can do with him. I'll be right back.
answer: Just you reconsider playing that message for him. No, I don't think he likes you at all. No, I don't like you either.

question: You know, I think that R2 unit we bought might have been stolen.
answer: What makes you think that?

question: Well, I stumbled across a recording while I was cleaning him. He says he belongs to someone called Obi-Wan Kenobi. I thought he might have meant old Ben. Do you know what he's talking about? Well, I wonder if he's related to Ben.
answer: That old man's just a crazy old wizard. Tomorrow I want you to take that R2 unit into Anchorhead and have its memory flushed. That'll be the end of it. It belongs to us now.

question: But what if this Obi-Wan comes looking for him?
answer: He won't, I don't think he exists any more. He died about the same time as your father.

question: He knew my father?
answer: I told you to forget it. Your only concern is to prepare the new droids for tomorrow. In the morning I want them on the south ridge working out those condensers.

question: Yes, sir. I think those new droids are going to work out fine. In fact, I, uh, was also thinking about our agreement about my staying on another season. And if these new droids do work out, I want to transmit my application to the Academy this year.
answer: You mean the next semester before harvest?

question: Sure, there're more than enough droids.
answer: Harvest is when I need you the most. Only one more season. This year we'll make enough on the harvest so I'll be able to hire some more hands. And then you can go to the Academy next year. You must understand I need you here, Luke.

question: But it's a whole 'nother year.
answer: Look, it's only one more season.

question: What are you doing hiding there?
answer: It wasn't my fault, sir. Please don't deactivate me. I told him not to go, but he's faulty, malfunctioning; kept babbling on about his mission.

question: Oh, no!
answer: That R2 unit has always been a problem. These astro-droids are getting quite out of hand. Even I can't understand their logic at times.

question: How could I be so stupid? He's nowhere in sight. Blast it!
answer: Pardon me, sir, but couldn't we go after him?

question: Luke? Luke? Luke? Where could he be loafing now! Have you seen Luke this morning?
answer: He said he had some things to do before he started today, so he left early.

question: Uh? Did he take those two new droids with him?
answer: I think so.

question: How's that. Old Ben Kenobi lives out in this direction somewhere, but I don't see how that R2 unit could have come this far. We must have missed him. Uncle Owen isn't going to take this very well.
answer: Sir, would it help if you told him it was my fault.

question: Sure. He needs you. He'd probably only deactivate you for a day or so...
answer: Deactivate! Well, on the other hand if you hadn't removed his restraining bolt...

question: Wait, there's something dead ahead on the scanner. It looks like our droid... hit the accelerator. Hey, whoa, just where do you think you're going?
answer: Master Luke here is your rightful owner. We'll have no more of this Obi-Wan Kenobi jibberish... and don't talk to me about your mission, either. You're fortunate he doesn't blast you into a million pieces right here.

question: Well, come on. It's getting late. I only hope we can get back before Uncle Owen really blows up.
answer: If you don't mind my saying so, sir, I think you should deactivate the little fugitive until you've gotten him back to your workshop.

question: No, he's not going to try anything. What's wrong with him now?
answer: Oh my... sir, he says there are several creatures approaching from the southeast.

question: Sandpeople! Or worst! Come on, let's have a look. Come on. There are two Banthas down there but I don't see any... wait a second, they're Sandpeople all right. I can see one of them now.
answer: Hello there! Come here my little friend. Don't be afraid. Don't worry, he'll be all right.

question: What happened?
answer: Rest easy, son, you've had a busy day. You're fortunate you're still in one piece.

question: Ben? Ben Kenobi! Boy, am I glad to see you!
answer: The Jundland wastes are not to be traveled lightly. Tell me young Luke, what brings you out this far?

question: Oh, this little droid! I think he's searching for his former master... I've never seen such devotion in a droid before... there seems to be no stopping him. He claims to be the property of an Obi-Wan Kenobi. Is he a relative of yours? Do you know who he's talking about?
answer: Obi-Wan Kenobi... Obi-Wan? Now thats a name I haven't heard in a long time... a long time.

question: I think my uncle knew him. He said he was dead.
answer: Oh, he's not dead, not... not yet.

question: You know him!
answer: Well of course, of course I know him. He's me! I haven't gone by the name Obi-Wan since oh, before you were born.

question: Then the droid does belong to you.
answer: Don't seem to remember ever owning a droid. Very interesting... I think we better get indoors. The Sandpeople are easily startled but they will soon be back and in greater numbers.

question: Threepio!
answer: Where am I? I must have taken a bad step...

question: Can you stand? We've got to get out of here before the Sandpeople return.
answer: I don't think I can make it. You go on, Master Luke. There's no sense in you risking yourself on my account. I'm done for.

question: No, you're not. What kind of talk is that?
answer: Quickly, son... they're on the move.

question: No, my father didn't fight in the wars. He was a navigator on a spice freighter.
answer: That's what your uncle told you. He didn't hold with your father's ideals. Thought he should have stayed here and not gotten involved.

question: You fought in the Clone Wars?
answer: Yes, I was once a Jedi Knight the same as your father.

question: I wish I'd known him.
answer: He was the best star-pilot in the galaxy, and a cunning warrior. I understand you've become quite a good pilot yourself. And he was a good friend. Which reminds me... I have something here for you. Your father wanted you to have this when you were old enough, but your uncle wouldn't allow it. He feared you might follow old Obi-Wan on some damned-fool idealistic crusade like your father did.

question: Sure, go ahead. What is it?
answer: Your fathers lightsaber. This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster. An elegant weapon for a more civilized time. For over a thousand generations the Jedi Knights were the guardians of peace and justice in the Old Republic. Before the dark times, before the Empire.

question: How did my father die?
answer: A young Jedi named Darth Vader, who was a pupil of mine until he turned to evil, helped the Empire hunt down and destroy the Jedi Knights. He betrayed and murdered your father. Now the Jedi are all but extinct. Vader was seduced by the dark side of the Force.

question: The Force?
answer: Well, the Force is what gives a Jedi his power. It's an energy field created by all living things. It surrounds us and penetrates us. It binds the galaxy together. Now, let's see if we can't figure out what you are, my little friend. And where you come from.

question: I saw part of the message he was...
answer: I seem to have found it.

question: You must learn the ways of the Force if you're to come with me to Alderaan.
answer: Alderaan? I'm not going to Alderaan. I've got to go home. It's late, I'm in for it as it is.

question: I need your help, Luke. She needs your help. I'm getting too old for this sort of thing.
answer: I can't get involved! I've got work to do! It's not that I like the Empire. I hate it! But there's nothing I can do about it right now. It's such a long way from here.

question: That's your uncle talking.
answer: Oh, God, my uncle. How am I ever going to explain this?

question: Learn about the Force, Luke.
answer: Look, I can take you as far as Anchorhead. You can get a transport there to Mos Eisley or wherever you're going.

question: The Imperial Senate will no longer be of any concern to us. I've just received word that the Emperor has dissolved the council permanently. The last remnants of the Old Republic have been swept away. The regional governors now have direct control over territories. Fear will keep the local systems in line. Fear of this battle station.
answer: The plans you refer to will soon be back in our hands. Don't be too proud of this technological terror you've constructed. The ability to destroy a planet is insignificant next to the power of the Force. I find your lack of faith disturbing.

question: Enough of this! Vader, release him!
answer: As you wish.

question: It looks like Sandpeople did this, all right. Look, here are Gaffi sticks, Bantha tracks. It's just... I never heard of them hitting anything this big before.
answer: They didn't. But we are meant to think they did. These tracks are side by side. Sandpeople always ride single file to hide there numbers.

question: These are the same Jawas that sold us Artoo and Threepio.
answer: And these blast points, too accurate for Sandpeople. Only Imperial stormtroopers are so precise.

question: Why would Imperial troops want to slaughter Jawas? If they traced the robots here, they may have learned who they sold them to. And that would lead them home!
answer: Wait, Luke! It's too dangerous.

question: They're for sale if you want them.
answer: Let me see your identification.

question: You don't need to see his identification.
answer: We don't need to see his identification.

question: These are not the droids your looking for.
answer: These are not the droids we're looking for.

question: He can go about his business.
answer: You can go about your business.

question: Move along.
answer: Move along. Move along.

question: Go on, go on. I can't understand how we got by those troopers. I thought we were dead.
answer: The Force can have a strong influence on the weak-minded. You will find it a powerful ally.

question: Do you really think we're going to find a pilot here that'll take us to Alderaan?
answer: Well, most of the best freighter pilots can be found here. Only watch your step. This place can be a little rough.

question: I'm ready for anything.
answer: Come along, Artoo.

question: What? Listen, why don't you wait out by the speeder. We don't want any trouble.
answer: I heartily agree with you sir.

question: Han Solo. I'm captain of the Millennium Falcon. Chewie here tells me you're looking for passage to the Alderaan system.
answer: Yes, indeed. If it's a fast ship.

question: Fast ship? You've never heard of the Millennium Falcon?
answer: Should I have?

question: It's the ship that made the Kessel run in less than twelve parsecs! I've outrun Imperial starships, not the local bulk-cruisers, mind you. I'm talking about the big Corellian ships now. She's fast enough for you, old man. What's the cargo?
answer: Only passengers. Myself, the boy, two droids, and no questions asked.

question: What is it? Some kind of local trouble?
answer: Let's just say we'd like to avoid any Imperial entanglements.

question: Going somewhere, Solo?
answer: Yes, Greedo. As a matter of fact, I was just going to see your boss. Tell Jabba that I've got his money.

question: It's too late. You should have paid him when you had the chance. Jabba's put a price on your head, so large that every bounty hunter in the galaxy will be looking for you. I'm lucky I found you first.
answer: Yeah, but this time I got the money.

question: If you give it to me, I might forget I found you.
answer: I don't have it with me. Tell Jabba...

question: Jabba's through with you. He has no time for smugglers who drop their shipments at the first sign of an Imperial cruiser.
answer: Even I get boarded sometimes. Do you think I had a choice?

question: You can tell that to Jabba. He may only take your ship.
answer: Over my dead body.

question: That's the idea. I've been looking forward to killing you for a long time.
answer: Yes, I'll bet you have. Sorry about the mess.

question: Come on out, Solo!
answer: I've been waiting for you, Jabba.

question: I expected you would be.
answer: I'm not the type to run.

question: Han, my boy, there are times when you disappoint me... why haven't you paid me? And why did you have to fry poor Greedo like that... after all we've been through together.
answer: You sent Greedo to blast me.

question: Han, why you're the best smuggler in the business. You're too valuable to fry. He was only relaying my concern at your delays. He wasn't going to blast you.
answer: I think he thought he was. Next time don't send one of those twerps. If you've got something to say to me, come see me yourself.

question: Han, Han! If only you hadn't had to dump that shipment of spice... you understand I just can't make an exception. Where would I be if every pilot who smuggled for me dumped their shipment at the first sign of an Imperial starship? It's not good business.
answer: You know, even I get boarded sometimes, Jabba. I had no choice, but I've got a charter now and I can pay you back, plus a little extra. I just need some more time.

question: Put your blasters away. Han, my boy, I'm only doing this because you're the best and I need you. So, for an extra, say twenty percent I'll give you a little more time... but this is it. If you disappoint me again, I'll put a price on your head so large you won't be able to go near a civilized system for the rest of your short life.
answer: Jabba, I'll pay you because it's my pleasure.

question: It'll take a few moments to get the coordinates from the navi-computer.
answer: Are you kidding? At the rate they're gaining...

question: Traveling through hyperspace isn't like dusting crops, boy! Without precise calculations we could fly right through a star or bounce too close to a supernova and that'd end your trip real quick, wouldn't it?
answer: What's that flashing?

question: Governor Tarkin, I should have expected to find you holding Vader's leash. I recognized your foul stench when I was brought on board.
answer: Charming to the last. You don't know how hard I found it signing the order to terminate your life!

question: I surprised you had the courage to take the responsibility yourself!
answer: Princess Leia, before your execution I would like you to be my guest at a ceremony that will make this battle station operational. No star system will dare oppose the Emperor now.

question: The more you tighten your grip, Tarkin, the more star systems will slip through your fingers.
answer: Not after we demonstrate the power of this station. In a way, you have determined the choice of the planet that'll be destroyed first. Since you are reluctant to provide us with the location of the Rebel base, I have chosen to test this station's destructive power... on your home planet of Alderaan.

question: No! Alderaan is peaceful. We have no weapons. You can't possibly...
answer: You would prefer another target? A military target? Then name the system! I grow tired of asking this. So it'll be the last time. Where is the Rebel base?

question: Dantooine. They're on Dantooine.
answer: There. You see Lord Vader, she can be reasonable. Continue with the operation. You may fire when ready.

question: What?
answer: You're far too trusting. Dantooine is too remote to make an effective demonstration. But don't worry. We will deal with your Rebel friends soon enough.

question: Well, you can forget your troubles with those Imperial slugs. I told you I'd outrun 'em. Don't everyone thank me at once. Anyway, we should be at Alderaan about oh-two-hundred hours.
answer: Now be careful, Artoo. He made a fair move. Screaming about it won't help you.

question: Let him have it. It's not wise to upset a Wookiee.
answer: But sir, nobody worries about upsetting a droid.

question: That's 'cause droids don't pull people's arms out of their socket when they lose. Wookiees are known to do that.
answer: I see your point, sir. I suggest a new strategy, Artoo. Let the Wookiee win.

question: Stand by, Chewie, here we go. Cut in the sublight engines. What the...? Aw, we've come out of hyperspace into a meteor shower. Some kind of asteroid collision. It's not on any of the charts.
answer: What's going on?

question: Our position is correct, except... no, Alderaan!
answer: What do you mean? Where is it?

question: Thats what I'm trying to tell you, kid. It ain't there. It's been totally blown away.
answer: What? How?

question: It's too big to be a space station.
answer: I have a very bad feeling about this.

question: Yeah, I think your right. Full reverse! Chewie, lock in the auxiliary power.
answer: Why are we still moving towards it?

question: We're caught in a tractor beam! It's pulling us in!
answer: But there's gotta be something you can do!

question: They must be trying to return the stolen plans to the princess. She may yet be of some use to us.
answer: There's no one on board, sir. According to the log, the crew abandoned ship right after takeoff. It must be a decoy, sir. Several of the escape pods have been jettisoned.

question: Did you find any droids?
answer: No, sir. If there were any on board, they must also have jettisoned.

question: Send a scanning crew on board. I want every part of this ship checked.
answer: Yes, sir.

question: I sense something... a presence I haven't felt since...
answer: Get me a scanning crew in here on the double. I want every part of this ship checked!

question: Boy you said it, Chewie. Where did you dig up that old fossil?
answer: Ben is a great man.

question: Yeah, great at getting us into trouble.
answer: I didn't hear you give any ideas...

question: Well, anything would be better than just hanging around waiting for him to pick us up...
answer: Who do you think... What is it?

question: Who do you think... What is it?
answer: I'm afraid I'm not quite sure, sir. He says "I found her", and keeps repeating, "She's here."

question: Well, who... who has he found?
answer: Princess Leia.

question: Oh, no! We've got to do something.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: The droid belongs to her. She's the one in the message... We've got to help her.
answer: Now, look, don't get any funny ideas. The old man wants us to wait right here.

question: But he didn't know she was here. Look, will you just find a way back into the detention block?
answer: I'm not going anywhere.

question: They're going to execute her. Look, a few minutes ago you said you didn't want to just wait here to be captured. Now all you want to do is stay.
answer: Marching into the detention area is not what I had in mind.

question: But they're going to kill her!
answer: Better her than me...

question: She's rich.
answer: Rich?

question: Yes. Rich, powerful! Listen, if you were to rescue her, the reward would be...
answer: What?

question: Well more wealth that you can imagine.
answer: I don't know, I can imagine quite a bit!

question: You'll get it!
answer: I better!

question: You will...
answer: All right, kid. But you'd better be right about this.

question: All right.
answer: What's your plan?

question: Uh... Threepio, hand me those binders there will you? Okay. Now, I'm going to put these on you. Okay. Han, you put these on.
answer: Don't worry, Chewie. I think I know what he has in mind.

question: Go get him! We've got to find out which cell this princess of yours is in. Here it is... cell twenty-one-eight-seven. You go get her. I'll hold them here. Everything is under control. Situation normal.
answer: What happened?

question: Uh... had a slight weapons malfunction. But, uh, everything's perfectly all right now. We're fine. We're all fine here, now, thank you. How are you?
answer: We're sending a squad up.

question: Uh, uh, negative. We had a reactor leak here now. Give us a few minutes to lock it down. Large leak... very dangerous.
answer: Who is this? What's your operating number?

question: Aren't you a little short to be a stormtrooper?
answer: What? Oh... the uniform. I'm Luke Skywalker. I'm here to rescue you.

question: You're who?
answer: I'm here to rescue you. I've got your R2 unit. I'm here with Ben Kenobi.

question: Ben Kenobi is here! Where is he?
answer: Come on!

question: He is here...
answer: Obi-Wan Kenobi! What makes you think so?

question: A tremor in the Force. The last time I felt it was in the presence of my old master.
answer: Surely he must be dead by now.

question: Don't underestimate the power of the Force.
answer: The Jedi are extinct, their fire has gone out of the universe. You, my friend, are all that's left of their religion. Yes.

question: See-Threepio! See-Threepio!
answer: Yes sir?

question: We've been cut off! Are there any other ways out of the cell bay?... What was that? I didn't copy!
answer: I said, all systems have been alerted to your presence, sir. The main entrance seems to be the only way in or out; all other information on your level is restricted. Oh, no!

question: It's worse.
answer: There's something alive in here!

question: That's your imagination.
answer: Something just moves past my leg! Look! Did you see that?

question: What?
answer: Help!

question: Are you there, sir?
answer: Threepio!

question: We've had some problems...
answer: Will you shut up and listen to me? Shut down all garbage mashers on the detention level, will you? Do you copy? Shut down all the garbage mashers on the detention level. Shut down all the garbage mashers on the detention level.

question: No. Shut them all down! Hurry! Listen to them! They're dying, Artoo! Curse my metal body! I wasn't fast enough. It's all my fault! My poor master!
answer: Threepio, we're all right!

question: Where are you going?
answer: No, wait. They'll hear!

question: Come here, you big coward! Chewie! Come here!
answer: Listen. I don't know who you are, or where you came from, but from now on, you do as I tell you. Okay?

question: Look, Your Worshipfulness, let's get one thing straight! I take orders from one person! Me!
answer: It's a wonder you're still alive. Will somebody get this big walking carpet out of my way?

question: Where are you going? Come back!
answer: He certainly has courage.

question: What good will it do us if he gets himself killed? Come on! I think we took a wrong turn.
answer: There's no lock!

question: That oughta hold it for a while.
answer: Quick, we've got to get across. Find the control that extends the bridge.

question: Oh, I think I just blasted it.
answer: They're coming through!

question: Here, hold this.
answer: Here they come! For luck!

question: Not a bad bit of rescuing, huh? You know, sometimes I even amaze myself.
answer: That doesn't sound too hard. Besides, they let us go. It's the only explanation for the ease of our escape.

question: Easy... you call that easy?
answer: Their tracking us!

question: Not this ship, sister.
answer: At least the information in Artoo is still intact.

question: What's so important? What's he carrying?
answer: The technical readouts of that battle station. I only hope that when the data is analyzed, a weakness can be found. It's not over yet!

question: It is for me, sister! Look, I ain't in this for your revolution, and I'm not in it for you, Princess. I expect to be well paid. I'm in it for the money!
answer: You needn't worry about your reward. If money is all that you love, then that's what you'll receive! Your friend is quite a mercenary. I wonder if he really cares about anything... or anyone.

question: I care! So... what do you think of her, Han?
answer: I'm trying not to, kid!

question: Good...
answer: Still, she's got a lot of spirit. I don't know, what do you think? Do you think a princess and a guy like me...

question: So... you got your reward and you're just leaving then?
answer: That's right, yeah! I got some old debts I've got to pay off with this stuff. Even if I didn't, you don't think I'd be fool enough to stick around here, do you? Why don't you come with us? You're pretty good in a fight. I could use you.

question: Come on! Why don't you take a look around? You know what's about to happen, what they're up against. They could use a good pilot like you. You're turning your back on them.
answer: What good's a reward if you ain't around to use it? Besides, attacking that battle station ain't my idea of courage. It's more like suicide.

question: All right. Well, take care of yourself, Han. I guess that's what you're best at, isn't it?
answer: Hey, Luke... may the Force be with you! What're you lookin' at? I know what I'm doing.

question: Thank you, sir. I'll try.
answer: I've got to get aboard. Listen, you'll tell me your stories when we come back. All right?

question: I told you I'd make it someday, Biggs.
answer: You did, all right. It's going to be like old times, Luke. We're a couple of shooting stars that'll never be stopped!
